content:
Is there a well supported lean+mathlib environment for emacs?

By that I don't mean "is it possible", but rather do enough people do it to create a community of people who can answer questions about it and also iteratively improve it?

I'm considering it for two reasons:

  • the UX for VSC is too noisy, and the maintainers seem to be "reticent" about considering suggestions for improvement
  • it is always good to balance mega-corportate software with open source alternatives

In terms of convenience, the infoview is key, but a less-intrusive "tooltip" would be amazing, and nice integrations into github are a nice-to-have. Oh - and "look up definition" is really handy.
I think I found something to explore: https://github.com/leanprover-community/lean4-mode
There's an entire channel devoted to this! See #Emacs
rzeta0 has marked this topic as resolved.
